segment.source: Limit the GPO Versions Stored
segment.target: Limit the GPO Versions Stored

segment.source: Limit the GPO Versions Stored
segment.target: Limit the GPO Versions Stored

segment.source: Limit the GPO Versions Stored
segment.target: Limit the GPO Versions Stored

segment.source: By default, all versions of every controlled Group Policy Object (GPO) are retained in the archive on the AGPM Server.
segment.target: By default, all versions of every controlled Group Policy Object (GPO) are retained in the archive on the AGPM Server.

segment.source: However, you can limit the number of versions retained for each GPO and delete older versions when that limit is exceeded.
segment.target: However, you can limit the number of versions retained for each GPO and delete older versions when that limit is exceeded.

segment.source: When GPO versions are deleted, a record of the version remains in the history of the GPO, but the GPO version itself is deleted from the archive.
segment.target: When GPO versions are deleted, a record of the version remains in the history of the GPO, but the GPO version itself is deleted from the archive.

segment.source: A user account with the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To limit the number of GPO versions stored
segment.target: To limit the number of GPO versions stored

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the AGPM Server tab.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the AGPM Server tab.

segment.source: Select the Delete old versions of each GPO from the archive check box, and type the maximum number of GPO versions to store for each GPO, not including the current version.
segment.target: Select the Delete old versions of each GPO from the archive check box, and type the maximum number of GPO versions to store for each GPO, not including the current version.

segment.source: To retain only the current version, enter 0.
segment.target: To retain only the current version, enter 0.

segment.source: The maximum must be no greater than 999.
segment.target: The maximum must be no greater than 999.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Only GPO versions displayed on the Unique Versions tab of the History window count toward the limit.
segment.target: Only GPO versions displayed on the Unique Versions tab of the History window count toward the limit.

segment.source: Click the Apply button.
segment.target: Click the Apply button.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Modify Options permissions for the domain.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Modify Options permissions for the domain.

segment.source: You can prevent a GPO version from being deleted by marking it in the history as ineligible for deletion.
segment.target: You can prevent a GPO version from being deleted by marking it in the history as ineligible for deletion.

segment.source: To do so, right-click the version in the history of the GPO and click Do Not Delete.
segment.target: To do so, right-click the version in the history of the GPO and click Do Not Delete.

segment.source: Additional references
segment.target: Additional references

segment.source: Managing the Archive
segment.target: Managing the Archive
